










































CONFIDENTIAL


 
RAILWAY RECRUITMENT BOARD, CHANDIGARH 

 

GOVT. OF INDIA (MINISTRY OF RAILWAYS) 
Railway Colony, Near Chandigarh Railway Station, Chandigarh-160002 

Website : www.rrbcdg.gov.in               Phone No : (0172) 2730093                 Email : bisht.dinesh@gov.in                  Fax No : (0172) 2730040 

CONDUCT OF APTITUDE TEST AND TYPING SKILL TEST AGAINST CEN-03/2015  
Based on the performance in the 2nd stage Computer Based Test for Non-Technical Popular Category (Graduate) posts 

against CEN-3/2015 conducted by this Railway Recruitment Board during the period from 17.01.2017 to 19.01.2017, the 

candidates bearing the following Roll Nos. have been provisionally shortlisted to appear in Aptitude Test for the posts of 

Assistant Station Master (ASM), (Cat. No.7) and /or Typing Skill Test for the posts of Senior Clerk-cum-Typist (Cat 

No.6). Accordingly, these shortlisted candidates will be intimated through SMS /e-mail for downloading of e-call letters to 

appear in Aptitude Test/Typing Skill Test likely to be held in June, 2017. Some of the candidates have been called in 

both the tests. 

 
 

APTITUDE TEST (Assistant Station Master – NR): TABLE - A

Note:  

Aptitude Test 

1. Aptitude Test will be conducted in Computer Based Test (CBT) mode. Candidates appearing in Aptitude Test are 
required to secure more than the cut-off marks in all tests of Aptitude Test batteries in order to be considered as 

suitable. The marks obtained in Aptitude Test by the candidates who are only considered suitable, will be added to 

marks obtained in 2nd stage CBT to prepare the final merit list for the post of ASM/Traffic Assistant. The ratio of 

2nd stage CBT marks and aptitude test marks shall be 70:30. However, if a candidate scores less than the cut-off 

marks in any test of Aptitude Test battery, he/she will be eliminated from the selection process for ASM. The 

candidates may visit the website of this RRB & view a mock-up link for Aptitude Test containing important 

instructions, test procedure, norms of evaluation etc. provided to guide the candidates appearing in the computer 

based Aptitude Test. 

2. Candidates for Aptitude Test are required to submit a Medical certificate fulfilling requisite Vision 
obtained from an Eye Specialist as per proforma (Annexure-IX, attached with e-call letter) at the time of 

Aptitude Test, failing which they will not be permitted to attend the Aptitude Test. 

 

Typing Skill Test 
3. The Typing Skill Test is qualifying in nature and the candidates appearing in Typing Skill Test have to type in the 

language opted during application viz. 300 words/ 1500 strokes at the minimum speed of 30 w.p.m. in English or 

250 words/ 1250 strokes at 25 w.p.m. in Hindi on computer within 10 minutes to qualify in the test else they 

(except PWD candidates) will be eliminated from the selection process for Sr. Clerk-cum-Typist. Candidates may 

please go through other important instructions in the e-call letter carefully.  

4. PWD candidates who claim exemption from typing Skill Test are required to submit the medical certificate stating 
“being unable to type” in prescribed proforma (Annexure-VIII, enclosed with e-call letter) issued by a Medical 



Board attached to the Special Employment Exchange or by a Civil Surgeon where such a Board does not exist to 

be produced at the venue itself on the date of Typing Skill Test, failing which they have to undergo the Typing 

Skill Test on the scheduled date:- 

 

LINK FOR UPLOADING THE  EXEMPTION MEDICAL CERTIFICATE 

              https://cdn.digialm.com:443//EForms/configuredHtml/1181/3453/login.html 
 

Cut off marks for other Posts 

5. In view  of the fact that most of the candidates, at different  merit positions, have given mixed preferences  for 
multiple posts, including the posts involving  Aptitude Test/Typing Skill Test, it is not feasible to release the cut 

off marks for any other post {Commercial Apprentice (Cat. No.1), Traffic Apprentice (Cat. No.2) & Goods Guard 

(Cat. No.4)} at this stage. 

 

General Instructions 

6. Candidates may please note that the roll numbers of the shortlisted candidates for Aptitude Test/Typing Skill Test 
mentioned above may not include roll numbers of candidates being provisionally considered for the posts of 

Commercial Apprentice (Cat. No.1), Traffic Apprentice (Cat. No.2) & Goods Guard (Cat. No.4) based on their 

merit and sequence of options. 

7. It may be noted that candidates, about eight times the number of modified vacancies have been shortlisted for 
Aptitude Test/Typing Skill Test primarily to avoid shortfall in the panel and merely calling a candidate for 

Aptitude Test/Typing Skill Test does not in any way entitle him/her to an appointment in the Railways. 

8. The candidature of all above mentioned candidates is purely provisional and subject to their fulfilling the 
eligibility criteria/conditions in all respects as indicated in the Centralized Employment Notice No. 03/2015, else 

their candidature is liable to be rejected at any stage of recruitment process. Further, candidature of any candidate 

featuring in the debar list, will be rejected at any stage. 

9. While every care has been taken in preparing the above short lists, this RRB reserves the right to rectify any 
inadvertent error or typographical mistake.  

 

 

IMPORTANT: Beware of the unscrupulous persons who may misguide the candidates with false promises of getting 

them selected for the job on illegal consideration. Don’t waste your valuable time and money being influenced by touters 

and cheaters. The recruitment process in the RRB exams is computerized and the selection is based purely on the merits of 

candidates. Beware of fake Railway Recruitment Board websites. There is no other website except www.rrbcdg.gov.in of 

this Railway Recruitment Board. Your awareness is your security. 
 

Notice No. 03/2017                                        Date : 30.05.2017                             Chairman, RRB/Chandigarh
